__TOC__

To install these packages, open a terminal and run this command (replacing '<packagename>' with the name of the package you want):

<pre>
sudo apt-get install <packagename>
</pre>

In order to download the packages from the ''universe'' and ''multiverse'' repositories, you must enable them in Synaptic or your <code>sources.list</code>. For more information, <nowiki>[[https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Repositories/Ubuntu#head-5bbef89639d9a7d93fe38f6356dc17847d373096|read this]]</nowiki>.

Try searching the repositories for different things; interesting queries could be e.g. ''icons'', ''themes'', ''gtk'', ''gnome'', ''beryl'' and so on. Search using this command:

<pre>
apt-cache search <query>
</pre>

If you want extended info about a specific package, you can also do:

<pre>
apt-cache show <package name>
</pre>

Again, replacing '<query>' and '<package name>' with your relevant queries.
